content.description: Stack of Cards is a fully bolted face climb and likely the best warm up for the wall. Steep but forgiving features lead up to a fun headwall. Sort of has that O.R.G. feel.
content.location: Start by coming into the route from the left by a few feet. From first bolt move up and towards the roof of Stacks. Move up through a head wall of cards. Near the top stay on the buttress and climb onto the belay ledge but beware of the cactus tenant.

content.description:
Gingerly make your way up past the bolts (likely a bit dirty and loose) to a stance on a ledge. From here the real (and good) climbing starts. Intriguing movement up a steep corner takes you to a stance over a lip, continue up engaging and kind of weird moves to a steep finish.  

  This is a LONG pitch. 70m rope just barley makes it to the ground if you swing into the base of the wall. KNOT THEN END of your rope! 

  It's also easy to fully top this one out if its you last route for the day.
content.protection: 2 Bolts at the Start.   Double set from 00c3 to #1c4, set of stoppers, optional #2 or #3.   2 bolt anchor
content.location: Just around the corner right of Stack of Cards, in a sort of alcove.

content.description: Follow fractures on perfect rock to an engaging mantel traverse. Finish out a seam
content.protection: 7 bolts and singles from .4 C4 to #1. Maybe a runner or two.
content.location: About 250' down canyon. Look for bolts.

content.description: Follow a seam up the face to a cool stemming/layback secting. Then dive into the flare and out the steep finish.
content.protection: Double set from 0 C3 to #1 C4 and a #2 and #3. 2 bolt anchor

content.description: East wall of the canyon. AM shade PM sun.
